Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Plaster \Plas"ter\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Plastered}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Plastering}.] [Cf. OF. plastrer to plaster (in sense 2), F. pl[^a]trer.] 1. To cover with a plaster, as a wound or sore. [1913 Webster]
2. To overlay or cover with plaster, as the ceilings and walls of a house. [1913 Webster]
3. Fig.: To smooth over; to cover or conceal the defects of; to hide, as with a covering of plaster. --Bale. [1913 Webster]

plastered adj 1: (of hair) made smooth by applying a sticky or glossy substance; "black hair plastered with pomade" [syn: {slicked}] 2: (of walls) covered with a coat of plaster [syn: {sealed}] 3: very drunk [syn: {besotted}, {blind drunk}, {blotto}, {crocked}, {cockeyed}, {fuddled}, {loaded}, {pie-eyed}, {pissed}, {pixilated}, {potty}, {slopped}, {sloshed}, {smashed}, {soaked}, {soused}, {sozzled}, {squiffy}, {stiff}, {tiddly}, {tiddley}, {tight}, {tipsy}, {wet}]
